item.title: Towards Structured Knowledge: Advancing Triple Extraction from Regional Trade Agreements using Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2510.05121v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This study investigates the effectiveness of Large Language Models (LLMs) for the extraction of structured knowledge in the form of Subject-Predicate-Object triples. We apply the setup for the domain of Economics application. The findings can be appli...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> zero-shot, prompt, few-shot, LLM, prompting | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.

item.title: MADS: Multi-Agent Dialogue Simulation for Diverse Persuasion Data Generation
item.description: arXiv:2510.05124v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose MADS (Multi-Agent Dialogue Simulation), a scalable framework for generating persuasive multi-turn dialogues via agent self-play. MADS employs three coordinated agents: User Agents simulating diverse persona-driven behaviors, a Dialog Agent ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompt, LLM, framework, arxiv, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 60%</small>
